questions.question: Question 3:
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Phát âm đuôi 's'. 'parents' phát âm là /s/, các từ còn lại phát âm là /z/ [cite: 1294-1302].
questions.group_instruction: I. Choose the words whose underlined part is pronounced differently from that of the others in each group.

questions.question: Question 4:
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Phát âm nguyên âm 'i'. 'ideal' phát âm là /aɪ/, các từ còn lại phát âm là /ɪ/ [cite: 1303-1311].

questions.question: Question 5:
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Phát âm phụ âm 's/c'. 'close' phát âm là /z/, các từ còn lại phát âm là /s/ [cite: 1312-1322].
questions.group_instruction: I. Choose the words whose underlined part is pronounced differently from that of the others in each group.

questions.question: Question 6: "What would you like to eat now?" - "_______"
questions.explanation: Tình huống giao tiếp: Hỏi về món ăn (eat), đáp án C (mì) là phù hợp nhất [cite: 1323-1334].
questions.group_instruction: II. Choose the word/ phrase (A, B, C or D) that best suits the blank in each sentence.

questions.question: Question 7: _______ your teacher? - Yes, I do. She is very beautiful.
questions.explanation: Dựa vào câu trả lời 'Yes, I do', câu hỏi phải bắt đầu bằng 'Do you'. Động từ 'like' phù hợp ngữ cảnh [cite: 1335-1343].
questions.group_instruction: II. Choose the word/ phrase (A, B, C or D) that best suits the blank in each sentence.

questions.question: Question 8: How _______ kilos of beef does she want?
questions.explanation: Câu hỏi số lượng với danh từ đếm được số nhiều (kilos): dùng 'How many' [cite: 1344-1350].
questions.group_instruction: II. Choose the word/ phrase (A, B, C or D) that best suits the blank in each sentence.

questions.question: Question 9: I need some tea. Please give me a _______ of tea.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức lượng từ: 'a packet of tea' (một túi trà) là cách dùng phổ biến [cite: 1351-1358].
questions.group_instruction: II. Choose the word/ phrase (A, B, C or D) that best suits the blank in each sentence.

questions.question: Question 10: How do they want _______ to work? - By minibus.
questions.explanation: Cả 'to go' và 'to travel' đều hợp lý khi hỏi về cách thức di chuyển đến nơi làm việc [cite: 1359-1370].
questions.group_instruction: II. Choose the word/ phrase (A, B, C or D) that best suits the blank in each sentence.

questions.question: Question 11: _______ tonight? - Nothing.
questions.explanation: Thì hiện tại tiếp diễn dùng để hỏi về kế hoạch trong tương lai gần (tonight) [cite: 1371-1378].
questions.group_instruction: II. Choose the word/ phrase (A, B, C or D) that best suits the blank in each sentence.

questions.question: Question 12: I like the atmosphere in the countryside. It is so _______. (peace)
questions.explanation: Sau trạng từ 'so' cần một tính từ: peace (n) -> peaceful (adj) [cite: 1379-1385].
questions.group_instruction: III. Supply the correct form of the word in brackets.

questions.question: Question 13: John's _______ improved at his new school. (behave)
questions.explanation: Sau sở hữu cách 'John's' cần một danh từ: behave (v) -> behavior (n) [cite: 1386-1395].
questions.group_instruction: III. Supply the correct form of the word in brackets.

questions.question: Question 14: I really _______ to see my best friend come back from Hue. (hopeful)
questions.explanation: Sau chủ ngữ 'I' cần một động từ: hopeful (adj) -> hope (v) [cite: 1396-1402].
questions.group_instruction: III. Supply the correct form of the word in brackets.

questions.question: Question 15: Different colours are good for _______ rooms in your house. (difference)
questions.explanation: Trước danh từ 'rooms' cần một tính từ: difference (n) -> different (adj) [cite: 1403-1410].
questions.group_instruction: III. Supply the correct form of the word in brackets.

questions.question: Question 16: My mother always _______ our house when the New Year comes every year. (decoration)
questions.explanation: Sau chủ ngữ 'My mother' cần động từ chia ở thì hiện tại đơn (always): decoration (n) -> decorates (v) [cite: 1411-1420].
questions.group_instruction: III. Supply the correct form of the word in brackets.

questions.explanation: Cấu trúc giới thiệu: 'This is + danh từ số ít' [cite: 1421-1425].

questions.passage_text: This (17) _______ Smith's room. You can see, his room is not very large. (18) _______ are two chairs, a table, a bed, a wardrobe and a bookshelf in his room. The table is near (19) _______ window. There is an ink-pot, some books and an English-Vietnamese dictionary on the table. The bed is on the right. There are also some books and newspapers on the bed. The wardrobe is opposite the bed. Smith has many clothes. Those clothes are all in the wardrobe. The bookshelf is (20) _______ the wall. There are many (21) _______ on it.

questions.question: Question 22: How many seasons are there in their country? What are they?
questions.correct_answer: There are four seasons: spring, summer, fall and winter.
questions.explanation: Thông tin trong bài: 'There are four seasons in a year... They are spring, summer, fall and winter' [cite: 1466-1469].
questions.group_instruction: V. Read the following passage and answer the questions below.
questions.passage_text: Hien and Hoa are students. They live in Viet Nam. There are four seasons in a year in their country. They are spring, summer, fall and winter. In the spring, the weather is usually warm. Sometimes it is cold, but not very cold. There are many flowers in this season. After spring, it is the summer. In the summer, the days are long and the nights are short. They often go on vacation in the summer. Fall is nice season. The weather is often cool. In the winter, it is usually very cold. The days are short and the nights are long. They always wear warm clothes in the winter.

questions.question: Question 23: What is the weather like in the spring?
questions.explanation: Thông tin trong bài: 'In the spring, the weather is usually warm' [cite: 1473-1476].

questions.question: Question 27: store/take/ department/to/bus/ you/should/a/get/to/the.
questions.correct_answer: You should take a bus to get to the department store.
questions.explanation: Sắp xếp theo cấu trúc khuyên bảo: S + should + V [cite: 1511-1512].
questions.group_instruction: VI. Reorder the following words to make meaningful sentences.

questions.question: Question 28: would/good/camping/it/ be/ a/ weekend/ idea/to/go/this.
questions.correct_answer: It would be a good idea to go camping this weekend.
questions.explanation: Cấu trúc giả định/gợi ý: It would be a good idea to + V [cite: 1515-1516].
questions.group_instruction: VI. Reorder the following words to make meaningful sentences.

questions.question: Question 29: Winsor castle/ the/beautiful/ is/world/ the/one/most/of/ castles/in/the.
questions.correct_answer: The Winsor castle is one of the most beautiful castles in the world.
questions.explanation: Cấu trúc so sánh nhất: one of the most + tính từ dài + danh từ số nhiều [cite: 1518-1519].
questions.group_instruction: VI. Reorder the following words to make meaningful sentences.

questions.question: Question 30: there/my/a/ trees/lot/school/on/to/are/ the way / of.
questions.correct_answer: There are a lot of trees on the way to my school.
questions.explanation: Cấu trúc tồn tại: There are + a lot of + danh từ số nhiều [cite: 1523-1524].
questions.group_instruction: VI. Reorder the following words to make meaningful sentences.

questions.question:
Question 31: Each classroom in my school has one projector and one computer.
=> There is _______
questions.correct_answer: There is one projector and one computer in each classroom in my school.
questions.explanation: Chuyển đổi từ 'S + has' sang 'There is/are' [cite: 1529-1532].
questions.group_instruction: VII. Rewrite the following sentences based on the given words.

questions.question:
Question 32: We have a plan to visit him on Tuesday next week.
=> We are _______
questions.correct_answer: We are visiting him on Tuesday next week.
questions.explanation: Sử dụng thì hiện tại tiếp diễn thay cho 'have a plan to' để chỉ một kế hoạch chắc chắn [cite: 1533-1536].
questions.group_instruction: VII. Rewrite the following sentences based on the given words.

questions.question:
Question 33: Mary usually gets 8 for her Maths tests. Dave usually gets 10 for his Maths tests.
=> Dave is _______
questions.correct_answer: Dave is better at Maths than Mary.
questions.explanation: Sử dụng cấu trúc so sánh hơn với tính từ 'good' -> 'better' [cite: 1538-1540].
questions.group_instruction: VII. Rewrite the following sentences based on the given words.

questions.question:
Question 34: No pyramid in the world is greater than the Great Pyramid of Giza.
=> The Great Pyramid of Giza _______
questions.correct_answer: The Great Pyramid of Giza is the greatest pyramid in the world.
questions.explanation: Chuyển đổi từ so sánh hơn sang so sánh nhất [cite: 1543-1545].

questions.question: Question 11: It was suggested that Pedro <u>studies</u> (A) the material <u>more</u> (B) thoroughly before attempting <u>to pass</u> (C) <u>the exam</u> (D).
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Thức giả định. Cấu trúc: S1 + be + suggested (+that) + S2 + (should) Vo. Sửa: studies => study.
questions.group_instruction: Task 3. Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the underlined part that needs correction in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 12: <u>Children</u> (A) nowadays seem <u>to be</u> (B) <u>more intelligenter</u> (C) than their parents when they were <u>at</u> (D) the same age.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: So sánh hơn. Công thức so sánh hơn với tính từ dài: S + be + more + long adj + than + S2. Sửa: more intelligenter => more intelligent.
questions.group_instruction: Task 3. Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the underlined part that needs correction in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 13: One of the reasons why families break up is that parents are always <u>critical</u> of each other.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ trái nghĩa. critical (adj): chỉ trích >< supportive (adj): giúp đỡ, cảm thông.
questions.group_instruction: Task 4. Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the word(s) OPPOSITE in meaning to the underlined word(s) in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 14: Using Facebook, you can <u>post</u> update sayings about your life everyday.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ trái nghĩa. post (v): đăng tải >< displace (v): thay thế, dời bỏ, xóa bỏ.
questions.group_instruction: Task 4. Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the word(s) OPPOSITE in meaning to the underlined word(s) in each of the following questions.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ đồng nghĩa. efficient (adj): hiệu quả = successful (adj): thành công.

questions.question: Question 22: Patient: "Can I make an appointment to see the doctor, please?" - Receptionist: "_______"

Although the definition of a family may not change, (27) _______ relationship of people to each other within the family group changes as society changes. Children, too, especially adolescents, have to (30) _______ with the members of their family in sharing household tasks.

questions.question: Question 31: The pronoun "they" in the second paragraph refers to _______

questions.group_instruction: Task 10. Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the questions.
questions.passage_text: Harvard University, today recognized as part of the top echelon of the world's universities, came from very inauspicious and humble beginning. This oldest of American universities was founded in 1636, just sixteen years after the Pilgrims landed at Plymouth. Included in the puritan emigrants to the Massachusetts colony during this period were more than 100 graduates of England's prestigious Oxford and Cambridge universities, and these universities graduate in the New Word were determined that their sons would have the same educational opportunities that they themselves had had. Because of this support in the colony for an institution of higher learning, the General Court of Massachusetts appropriated 400 pounds for a college in October of 1636 and early the following year decided on a parcel of land for the school; this land was in an area called Newetowne, which was later renamed Cambridge after its English cousin and is the site of the present-day university. When a young minister named John Harvard, who came from the neighboring town of Charlestowne, died from tuberculosis in 1638, he willed half of his estate of 1,700 pounds to the fledgling college. In spite of the fact that only half of the bequest was actually paid, the General Court named the college after the minister in appreciation for what he had done. The amount of the bequest may not have been large, particularly by today's standard, but it was more than the General Court had found it necessary to appropriate in order to open the college. Henry Dunster was appointed the first president of Harvard in 1640, and it should be noted that in addition to serving as president, he was also the entire faculty, with an entering freshmen class of four students. Although the staff did expand somewhat, for the first century of its existence the entire teaching staff consisted of the president and three or four tutors.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Đọc hiểu. Thông tin: '...appropriated 400 pounds for a college...' (chi 400 bảng Anh).

questions.question:
Question 36: Although he was very tired, he agreed to help me with my homework.
=> Tired _______
questions.correct_answer: as he was, he agreed to help me with my homework
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Mệnh đề nhượng bộ. Cấu trúc: Adj + as/ though + S1 + be, S2 + V2.

Question 37: The man works for my father's company. The man's daughter is fond of dancing. (relative clauses)
=> _______
questions.correct_answer: The man whose daughter is fond of dancing works for my father's company.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Mệnh đề quan hệ. Dùng 'whose' để thay thế cho sở hữu 'The man's'.
questions.group_instruction: Task 11. Rewrite the following sentences so that it means the same as the sentence before it.

questions.question:
Question 38: "I'm sorry, Angela, I'm afraid I've damaged your car," said Martin.
=> Martin apologized _______
questions.correct_answer: to Angela for having damaged her car
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Câu tường thuật. Cấu trúc: S + apologized (+ to O) + for V-ing (xin lỗi ai vì điều gì).

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Câu bị động đặc biệt. Cấu trúc: S2 + am/is/are + thought + to V.

questions.question: Question 5: I took off the shoes before entering the room _______

options.A: so that I not dirty the floor
options.B: in order to not dirty the floor
options.C: so as not to dirty the floor
options.D: in order not dirtying the floor

questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Mệnh đề chỉ mục đích.
Giải thích:
so that + S + V: để mà
in order (not) to V: để (không)
so as (not) to V: để (không)
dirty (v): làm bẩn
A sai => so that I didn't dirty the floor
B, D sai => in order not to dirty the floor
Tạm dịch: Tôi đã cởi giày trước khi vào phòng để không làm bẩn sàn nhà.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 6: The last time when I saw her was three years ago.

options.A: I saw her three years ago and will never meet her again.
options.B: About three years ago, I used to meet her.
options.C: I have not seen her for three years.
options.D: I have often seen her for the last three years.

questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Thì hiện tại hoàn thành.
Giải thích: Cách dùng: diễn tả sự việc bắt đầu từ quá khứ, kéo dài và để lại kết quả ở hiện tại. Cấu trúc: S + have/has (not) + P2 + since + mốc thời gian / for + khoảng thời gian. = The last time when S + V-ed/cột 2 was + thời gian trong quá khứ.
Tạm dịch: Lần cuối cùng khi tôi gặp cô ấy là ba năm trước. = C. Tôi đã không gặp cô ấy ba năm rồi.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 7: Mike: "I took a picture of you just now." - Robert: "Really? I _______ with attention."
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Thì quá khứ tiếp diễn.
Giải thích: just now = only a short time ago. Câu trả lời muốn ám chỉ trực tiếp vào thời gian lúc mà người kia chụp ảnh => thời điểm chính xác, cụ thể trong quá khứ => dùng thì quá khứ tiếp diễn. Công thức: S + was/were + V-ing.
Tạm dịch: Mike: "Tớ vừa chụp một bức ảnh của cậu." - Robert: "Thật á? Tớ đã không đang chú ý lúc đó."
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 8: Failure to win the championship will _______ in the dismissal of the coach.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Từ vựng.
Giải thích: happen (v): xảy ra; cause (v): gây ra = result in = lead to; affect (v): tác động đến. Sau chỗ trống có "in" => chọn "result".
Tạm dịch: Không giành được chức vô địch sẽ dẫn đến việc sa thải huấn luyện viên.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 9: He only had time to _______ into the report. He couldn't read it thoroughly.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Cụm động từ.
Giải thích: dip into sth: to read or watch only parts of something (chỉ đọc hoặc xem lướt qua). Tạm dịch: Anh chỉ có thời gian để xem lướt qua báo cáo. Anh ấy không thể đọc kỹ.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 10: It was your assistance that enabled us to get achievement.

options.A: Your assistance discouraged us from get achievement.
options.B: But for your assistance, we could not have got achievement.
options.C: If you assisted us, we could not get achievement.
options.D: Without your assistance, we could get achievement.

questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Các từ thay thế cho "if".
Giải thích: Câu gốc có các động từ chia thì quá khứ đơn => dùng câu điều kiện không có thật ở quá khứ. Cấu trúc: But for + N, S + would/could... (not) have P2 (nếu không có...). Tạm dịch: Chính sự hỗ trợ của bạn đã giúp chúng tôi đạt được thành tích. = B. Nếu không nhờ sự hỗ trợ của bạn, chúng tôi đã không thể đạt được thành tích.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 11: The basketball team knew they lost the match. They soon started to blame each other.

options.A: Hardly had the basketball team known they lost the match when they started to blame each other.
options.B: Not only did the basketball team lose the match but they blamed each other as well.
options.C: As soon as they blamed each other, the basketball team knew they lost the match.
options.D: No sooner had the basketball team started to blame each other than they knew they lost the match.

questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Đảo ngữ.
Giải thích: Cấu trúc: Hardly + trợ đt + S + V when + S + V: vừa mới ... thì ... Tạm dịch: Đội bóng rổ biết rằng họ đã thua trận. Họ sớm bắt đầu đổ lỗi cho nhau. = A. Ngay sau khi đội bóng rổ biết rằng họ đã thua trận thì họ bắt đầu đổ lỗi cho nhau.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 12: _______ from school for three weeks, so he is trying his best to catch up with the other students.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Thì hiện tại hoàn thành.
Giải thích: Dấu hiệu: "for three weeks". Không rút gọn mệnh đề đầu vì mệnh đề sau vẫn còn liên từ "so". Tạm dịch: Cậu ấy đã nghỉ học ba tuần, vì vậy cậu đang cố gắng hết sức để bắt kịp các học sinh khác.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 13: Frankly, I'd rather you _______ not involved in the case.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Thức giả định.
Giải thích: would rather sb + V-quá khứ đơn: muốn ai làm gì. Tạm dịch: Thành thật mà nói, tôi muốn anh không tham gia vào vụ này.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 14: We _______ open the lion's cage. It is contrary to zoo regulations.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Động từ khuyết thiếu.
Giải thích: mustn't: không được, cấm. Tạm dịch: Chúng ta không được mở chuồng sư tử. Nó trái với quy định của sở thú.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 15: In the kitchen, there is a _______ table.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Trật tự tính từ.
Giải thích: Sắp xếp theo thứ tự OSAShCOMP: opinion (beautiful) -> size (large) -> shape (round) -> material (wooden). Tạm dịch: Trong bếp, có một chiếc bàn gỗ tròn lớn rất đẹp.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 16: Neil Armstrong was the first man _______ on the moon.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Mệnh đề quan hệ rút gọn.
Giải thích: Trước mệnh đề quan hệ có các từ chỉ thứ tự (the first, second, last,...) => rút gọn dùng to V. Tạm dịch: Neil Armstrong là người đầu tiên đi bộ trên mặt trăng.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 17: There are so many kinds of LCD televisions on sale that I can't make up my mind _______ to buy.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Từ vựng.
Giải thích: which to buy: mua cái nào. Tạm dịch: Có quá nhiều loại ti vi LCD được bày bán khiến tôi không thể quyết định nên mua loại nào.

questions.question: Question 18: Because it was an interesting novel, I stayed up all night to finish it.

options.A: Though it was an interesting novel, I stayed up all night to finish it.
options.B: Unless it was an interesting novel, I would stay up all night to finish it.
options.C: I stayed up all night to finish the novel, therefore it was interesting.
options.D: So interesting was the novel that I stayed up all night to finish it.

questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Đảo ngữ.
Giải thích: Cấu trúc So + adj + be + S + that: quá ... đến mức. Tạm dịch: Cuốn tiểu thuyết thú vị đến mức tôi đã thức cả đêm để đọc xong toàn bộ.

questions.question: Question 19: Development of the area would _______ wildlife.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Từ loại.
Giải thích: Sau "would" cần điền động từ nguyên thể => endanger (v): gây nguy hiểm. Tạm dịch: Sự phát triển của khu vực sẽ gây nguy hiểm cho động vật hoang dã.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 20: After months of searching, I finally _______ to land a job as an accountant in an insurance company.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Từ vựng.
Giải thích: managed to V: thành công trong việc làm gì. Tạm dịch: Sau hàng tháng trời tìm kiếm, tôi đã thành công tìm được việc làm kế toán cho một công ty bảo hiểm.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 21: The festival was a failure. It was _______
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Trạng từ / Câu bị động.
Giải thích: Cấu trúc câu bị động: S + be + (adv) + P2. Trạng từ "badly" bổ nghĩa cho động từ "organized". Tạm dịch: Lễ hội đã thất bại. Nó được tổ chức thật là tệ.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following 10 questions.

questions.question: Question 22: Simon continued to be denied a promotion _______ his efforts through the years.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Mệnh đề nhượng bộ.
Giải thích: in spite of + N/V-ing: mặc cho, bất chấp. Tạm dịch: Simon tiếp tục bị từ chối thăng chức bất chấp những nỗ lực của anh ấy trong suốt nhiều năm.

questions.question: Question 23: - David: "I failed my driving test yesterday." - Tom: "_______"

options.A: You should try your best at it!
options.B: You want to pass the test. Dream on!
options.C: I wish that we could talk about it!
options.D: Oh well. You're in a good company!

questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Ngôn ngữ giao tiếp.
Giải thích: - David: "Mình đã trượt bài kiểm tra lái xe ngày hôm qua." - Tom: "Bạn nên cố gắng hết sức mình!" => Phương án A phù hợp nhất theo đáp án gốc.

questions.question: Question 24: Those who are riding a motorbike are not allowed to take off their helmet.

options.A: You should not wear a helmet when you are riding a motorbike.
options.B: Those who are wearing a helmet are not allowed to ride a motorbike.
options.C: It is the helmet that one needn't wear when he is riding a motorbike.
options.D: People must never take their helmet off while they are riding a motorbike.

questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Động từ khuyết thiếu.
Giải thích: be not allowed to V = must never V (không bao giờ được làm gì). Tạm dịch: Người đi xe máy không được cởi mũ bảo hiểm.

questions.question: Question 26: <u>There were</u> (A) so <u>much</u> (B) books in the library <u>that</u> (C) I didn't know which one <u>to choose</u> (D).
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Lượng từ.
Giải thích: "books" là danh từ số nhiều đếm được => không dùng với "much". Sửa: much => many.

questions.question: Question 27: He <u>comes from</u> (A) a <u>remote and mountainous</u> (B) area <u>locating</u> (C) in <u>the south</u> (D).
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Mệnh đề quan hệ rút gọn.
Giải thích: Chủ ngữ "area" (khu vực), động từ "locate" (tọa lạc) => chủ ngữ không thể tự thực hiện hành động => câu bị động. Rút gọn dùng P2. Sửa: locating => located.

questions.question: Question 28: Benjamin Franklin <u>was</u> (A) the editor of <u>the largest</u> (B) newspaper in the colonies, a diplomatic representative to France, and <u>he invented</u> (C) many <u>useful</u> (D) devices.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Cấu trúc song hành.
Giải thích: "and" liên kết các cụm từ bắt đầu bằng danh từ chỉ nghề nghiệp => sau "and" cũng phải cùng cấu trúc. Sửa: he invented many useful devices => the inventor of many useful devices.

questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Từ vựng.
Giải thích: widespread (adj): lan rộng, phổ biến = common (adj): phổ biến, chung chung. Tạm dịch: Tăng huyết áp là một trong những căn bệnh phổ biến và tiềm ẩn nhiều nguy cơ.

options.A: a subject that I don't understand
options.B: an object that I really love
options.C: a book that is never opened
options.D: a theme that I like to discuss

questions.explanation:

questions.explanation:

Giải thích: lost contact with sb: mất liên lạc với ai >< got in touch with: giữ liên lạc với ai.

questions.explanation:

questions.question: Question 33: Speech is one of the most important communicating (33) _______.
questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Từ vựng.
Giải thích: ways: cách, phương thức. Tạm dịch: Lời nói là một trong những cách giao tiếp quan trọng nhất.
questions.group_instruction: Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct word or phrase that best fits each of the blanks.
questions.passage_text:
Speech is one of the most important communicating (33) _______. It consists of far more than just making noises. To talk and also to be understood by other people, we have to speak a language, that is, we have to use combinations of sounds that everyone agrees to stand for a particular object or idea. Communication would be impossible if everyone made up their own language.
Learning a language properly is very (34) _______. The basic vocabulary of English is not very large, and not only about 2,000 words are needed to speak it quite (35) _______ but the more idea you can express the more precise you can be about their exact meaning.
Words are the (36) _______ thing we use in communicating what we want to say. The way we say the words is also very important. Our tone of voice can express many emotions and show whether we are pleased or angry, for instance.

questions.question: Question 37: Which of the following is the best title for this reading?

options.D: The Honeybee - Its Characteristics and Usefulness

questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Đọc hiểu – ý chính.
Giải thích: Tiêu đề hay nhất cho bài đọc này là "Ong mật - Đặc điểm và tính hữu dụng của nó".
questions.group_instruction: Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following questions.
questions.passage_text:
Bees, classified into over 10,000 species, are insects found in almost every part of the world except the northernmost and southernmost regions. One commonly known species is the honeybee, the only bee that produces honey and wax. Humans use wax in making candles, lipsticks, and other products, and they use honey as food. While gathering the nectar and pollen with which they make honey, bees are simultaneously helping to fertilize the flowers on which they land. Many fruits and vegetables would not survive if bees did not carry the pollen from blossom to blossom.
Bees live in a structured environment and social structure within a hive, which is a nest with storage space for the honey. The different types of bees each perform a unique function. The worker bee carries nectar to the hive in a special stomach called a honey stomach. Other workers make beeswax and shape it into a honeycomb, which is a waterproof mass of six-sided compartments, or cells. The queen lays eggs in completed cells. As the workers build more cells, the queen lays more eggs. All workers, like the queen, are female, but the workers are smaller than the queen. The male honeybees are called drones; they do no work and cannot sting. They are developed from unfertilized eggs, and their only job is to impregnate a queen. The queen must be fertilized in order to lay worker eggs. During the season when less honey is available and the drones are of no further use, the workers block the drones from eating the honey so that they will starve to death.

questions.explanation:

questions.question: Question 40: The author implies that

options.C: bees are unnecessary in the food chain.
options.D: the queen can be a worker.

questions.explanation:
Kiến thức: Đọc hiểu – suy luận.
Giải thích: Ong thợ và ong chúa đều là con cái. Ong mật đực được gọi là drones; chúng không làm việc gì. Drones là con đực nên không bao giờ là con cái (drones are never females).

The worker bee carries nectar to the hive in a special stomach called a honey stomach. Other workers make beeswax and shape it into a honeycomb, which is a waterproof mass of six-sided compartments, or cells. The queen lays eggs in completed cells. As the workers build more cells, the queen lays more eggs. All workers, like the queen, are female, but the workers are smaller than the queen. The male honeybees are called drones; they do no work and cannot sting. They are developed from unfertilized eggs, and their only job is to impregnate a queen. The queen must be fertilized in order to lay worker eggs. During the season when less honey is available and the drones are of no further use, the workers block the drones from eating the honey so that they will starve to death.

questions.question: Question 5: I _______ there once a long time ago and _______ back since.

questions.passage_text: Urbanisation programmes are being (28) in many parts of the world, especially in densely populated regions with limited land and resources. It is the natural outcome of economic development and (29). It has brought a lot of benefits to our society. (30), it also poses various problems for local authorities and town planners in the process of maintaining sustainable urbanisation, especially in developing countries. When too many people cram into a small area, urban infrastructure can't be effective. There will be a (31) of livable housing, energy and water supply. This will create overcrowded urban districts with no proper facilities. Currently, fast urbanisation is taking place predominantly in developing countries where sustainable urbanisation has little relevance to people's lives. Their houses are just shabby slums with poor sanitation. Their children only manage to get basic education. Hence, the struggle for survival is their first priority rather than anything else. Only when the quality of their existence is improved can they seek (32) other high values in their life.

questions.question: Question 33: According to the text, Marrination, when built, will be a(an) _______ city.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Đọc hiểu. Thông tin: The actual land would be about 300 feet below the sea level. Tạm dịch: Mặt đất thực tế sẽ thấp hơn mực nước biển khoảng 300 feet.
questions.group_instruction: Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the questions.
questions.passage_text: A Japanese construction company plans to create a huge independent city-state, akin to the legendary Atlantis, in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. The city, dubbed "Marinnation", would have about one million inhabitants, two airports, and possibly even a space port. Marinnation, if built, would be a separate country but could serve as a home for international organisations such as the United Nations and the World Bank. Aside from the many political and social problems that would have to be solved, the engineering task envisaged is monumental. The initial stage requires the building of a circular dam eighteen miles in diameter attached to the sea bed in a relatively shallow place in international waters. Then, several hundred powerful pumps, operating for more than a year, would suck out the sea water from within the dam. When empty and dry, the area would have a city constructed on it. The actual land would be about 300 feet below the sea level. According to designers, the hardest task from an engineering point of view would be to ensure that the dam is leak proof and earthquake proof. If all goes well, it is hoped that Marinnation could be ready for habitation at the end of the second decade of the twenty-first century. Whether anyone would want to live in such an isolated and artificial community, however, will remain an open question until that time.

Whether anyone would want to live in such an isolated and artificial community, however, will remain an open question until that time.

questions.question: Question 37: What does the author imply in the last sentence of the passage?

options.A: People will ask an open question about living in Marinnation.
options.B: The construction of Marinnation could never be completed in time.
options.C: People might not want to live in an isolated and artificial community.
options.D: People will ask how they can live in such an isolated and artificial city.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Đọc hiểu. Thông tin: Whether anyone would want to live in such an isolated and artificial community... will remain an open question.
questions.group_instruction: Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the questions.
questions.passage_text: A Japanese construction company plans to create a huge independent city-state, akin to the legendary Atlantis, in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. The city, dubbed "Marinnation", would have about one million inhabitants, two airports, and possibly even a space port. Marinnation, if built, would be a separate country but could serve as a home for international organisations such as the United Nations and the World Bank. Aside from the many political and social problems that would have to be solved, the engineering task envisaged is monumental. The initial stage requires the building of a circular dam eighteen miles in diameter attached to the sea bed in a relatively shallow place in international waters. Then, several hundred powerful pumps, operating for more than a year, would suck out the sea water from within the dam. When empty and dry, the area would have a city constructed on it. The actual land would be about 300 feet below the sea level. According to designers, the hardest task from an engineering point of view would be to ensure that the dam is leak proof and earthquake proof. If all goes well, it is hoped that Marinnation could be ready for habitation at the end of the second decade of the twenty-first century. Whether anyone would want to live in such an isolated and artificial community, however, will remain an open question until that time.

options.D: She had such a high raising of hand that she failed to attract her teacher's attention.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Mệnh đề chỉ mục đích. so that: để mà. Cô ấy giơ tay lên cao để có thể thu hút sự chú ý của giáo viên.

questions.passage_text: Urbanisation programmes are being (28) in many parts of the world, especially in densely populated regions with limited land and resources. It is the natural outcome of economic development and (29). It has brought a lot of benefits to our society. (30), it also poses various problems for local authorities and town planners in the process of maintaining sustainable urbanisation, especially in developing countries. When too many people cram into a small area, urban infrastructure can't be effective. There will be a (31) of livable housing, energy and water supply. This will create overcrowded urban districts with no proper facilities. Currently, fast urbanisation is taking place predominantly in developing countries where sustainable urbanisation has little relevance to people's lives. Their houses are just shabby slums with poor sanitation. Their children only manage to get basic education. Hence, the struggle for survival is their first priority rather than anything else. Only when the quality of their existence is improved can they seek (32) other high values in their life.

When too many people cram into a small area, urban infrastructure can't be effective. There will be a (31) of livable housing, energy and water supply. This will create overcrowded urban districts with no proper facilities. Currently, fast urbanisation is taking place predominantly in developing countries where sustainable urbanisation has little relevance to people's lives. Their houses are just shabby slums with poor sanitation. Their children only manage to get basic education. Hence, the struggle for survival is their first priority rather than anything else. Only when the quality of their existence is improved can they seek (32) other high values in their life.

questions.question: Question 33: According to the text, Marrination, when built, will be a(an) _______ city.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Đọc hiểu. Thông tin: The actual land would be about 300 feet below the sea level. Tạm dịch: Mặt đất thực tế sẽ thấp hơn mực nước biển khoảng 300 feet.
questions.group_instruction: Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the questions.
questions.passage_text: A Japanese construction company plans to create a huge independent city-state, akin to the legendary Atlantis, in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. The city, dubbed "Marinnation", would have about one million inhabitants, two airports, and possibly even a space port. Marinnation, if built, would be a separate country but could serve as a home for international organisations such as the United Nations and the World Bank. Aside from the many political and social problems that would have to be solved, the engineering task envisaged is monumental. The initial stage requires the building of a circular dam eighteen miles in diameter attached to the sea bed in a relatively shallow place in international waters. Then, several hundred powerful pumps, operating for more than a year, would suck out the sea water from within the dam. When empty and dry, the area would have a city constructed on it. The actual land would be about 300 feet below the sea level. According to designers, the hardest task from an engineering point of view would be to ensure that the dam is leak proof and earthquake proof. If all goes well, it is hoped that Marinnation could be ready for habitation at the end of the second decade of the twenty-first century. Whether anyone would want to live in such an isolated and artificial community, however, will remain an open question until that time.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Đọc hiểu. akin = similar (tương tự).

questions.question: Question 38: To attract her teacher's attention, she raised her hand high.

options.A: Because her teacher attracted her, she raised her hand again.
options.B: Though she raised her hand high, she couldn't attract her teacher's attention.
options.C: She raised her hand high so that she could attract the teacher's attention.
options.D: She had such a high raising of hand that she failed to attract her teacher's attention.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Mệnh đề chỉ mục đích. so that: để mà. Cô ấy giơ tay lên cao để có thể thu hút sự chú ý của giáo viên.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 39: The number of young people using social media is increasing.

options.A: There are more people using social media than in the past.
options.B: The number of social media for the youth is increasing.
options.C: More and more social media are for the youth.
options.D: More and more young people are using social media.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: So sánh kép. Cấu trúc so sánh kép với more and more + N: ngày càng nhiều. Ngày càng có nhiều người trẻ tuổi sử dụng phương tiện truyền thông xã hội.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 40: The problem was too serious for her to solve by herself.

options.A: The problem was such serious that she couldn't solve alone.
options.B: So serious was the problem that she couldn't solve it alone.
options.C: It was such a serious problem that she could solve it alone.
options.D: She was so serious she couldn't solve the problem alone.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Mệnh đề chỉ kết quả. Cấu trúc đảo ngữ: So + adj + be + N + that + S + V: ... quá... đến nỗi mà...
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 41: If it hadn't been for the wind, the fire would never have spread so fast.

options.A: Even without the wind, the fire would have spread just as fast.
options.B: It was the wind that caused the fire to spread at such a speed.
options.C: Had there been a wind, the fire would have spread even faster.
options.D: The force of the wind affected the way the fire spread.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Câu điều kiện loại 3 – Câu chẻ. Cấu trúc câu chẻ: It was + danh từ + that + S + V. Chính gió đã khiến ngọn lửa lan rộng với tốc độ như vậy.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 42: "Don't forget to hand in the report, Peter!" said Kate.

options.C: Kate forgot to hand in the report to Peter.
options.D: Kate reminded Peter to hand in the report.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Câu gián tiếp. remind sb + to V: nhắc nhở ai làm cái gì. Kate nhắc nhở Peter nộp bản báo cáo.

questions.question: Question 5: I _______ there once a long time ago and _______ back since.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Thì quá khứ đơn và hiện tại hoàn thành. Cấu trúc thì quá khứ đơn: S + V-ed/ V2. Dấu hiệu: "khoảng thời gian + ago". Cấu trúc thì hiện tại hoàn thành: S + have/has + P2. Dấu hiệu: "since" đứng cuối câu.

questions.question: Question 6: It is recommended that this machine _______ checked every year.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Thức giả định. Cấu trúc: It + be + adjective + that + S + (should) Vo.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 7: _______ is writing brief entries about the daily activities of an individual or company.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ vựng. D. Microblogging (n): Tiểu blog.

questions.question: Question 8: There are people who choose to abandon their heritage culture and assimilate _______ the new culture of the majority.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Giới từ. assimilate into/to something: đồng hóa/ hòa nhập với cái gì.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 9: You don't get a lot of _______ from a news report on radio or TV.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ loại. C. information (n): thông tin. a lot of + danh từ số nhiều/ danh từ không đếm được.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 10: Only after food has been dried or canned _______

options.A: that it should be stored for future use
options.B: it should be stored for future use
options.C: should it be stored for future use

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Câu đảo ngữ. Đảo ngữ với "only after": Only after S1+V1, trợ động từ + S2+V2.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 11: The areas _______ are destroyed suffer a lot from soil erosion.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Đại từ quan hệ. Trong mệnh đề quan hệ: whose + danh từ: thay cho danh từ/ tính từ sở hữu. Tạm dịch: Khu vực nơi rừng mà cây của nó bị phá hủy đất bị sói mòn đáng kể.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 12: Some ethnic groups have strange _______ such as walking on fire to prevent natural disasters.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ vựng. customs (n): phong tục, tục lệ.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 13: We managed to finish the exercise on time and passed the exam. _______ it was very difficult.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Liên từ. However: Tuy nhiên.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 14: He has the _______ face and skin of an old traveller.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ vựng. weather-beaten (adj): dầm mưa dãi nắng.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 15: It is stated that we are now in the first stages of a battle for the _______ life on the earth.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ vựng. conservation(n): sự bảo tồn.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 16: _______ Women's Day is on _______ eighth of March.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Mạo từ. Không dùng mạo từ trước các ngày lễ, tết. Cách viết ngày tháng: the + ngày (số thứ tự) + of + tháng.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 17: To <u>reduce</u> (A) pollution, we have to stop <u>to use</u> (B) many things that (C) make our lives <u>uncomfortable</u> (D).
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: to V/ V-ing. stop + V-ing: dừng làm gì. Sửa: to use => using.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the underlined part that needs correction in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 18: The <u>practice</u> (A) of using <u>many</u> (B) and more chemicals to improve crop <u>yields</u> (C) is <u>harmful</u> (D) to people's health.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: So sánh kép. Cấu trúc so sánh kép: S + V + so sánh hơn + and + so sánh hơn (ngày càng...). Sửa: many and more => more and more.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the underlined part that needs correction in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 19: The <u>pull of</u> (A) the earth is <u>too</u> (B) strong <u>that</u> (C) no one can <u>jump</u> (D) as high as three meters.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Cấu trúc "so...that". Cấu trúc: S1 + be + so + adj + that + S2 + V: ...quá... đến nỗi mà... Sửa: too => so.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the underlined part that needs correction in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 20: The work performed <u>by</u> (A) these officers <u>are</u> (B) not <u>worth</u> (C) our paying them any <u>longer</u> (D).
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Sự hòa hợp giữa chủ ngữ và động từ. "the work" số ít => dùng "is". Sửa: are => is.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the underlined part that needs correction in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 21: Nobody is <u>interested</u> (A) in the <u>missing</u> (B) jet planes, <u>aren't</u> (C) <u>they</u> (D)?
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Câu hỏi đuôi. Nobody (không ai cả) => phủ định => câu hỏi đuôi khẳng định và thay bằng chủ ngữ "they". Sửa: aren't => are.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the underlined part that needs correction in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 22: One of the reasons why families break up is that parents are always <u>critical</u> of each other.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ trái nghĩa. critical (adj): chỉ trích, phê bình. supportive (adj): cảm thông. => critical >< supportive.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the word(s) OPPOSITE in meaning to the underlined word(s) in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 23: Urbanization has resulted in <u>massive</u> problems besides the benefits.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ trái nghĩa. massive (adj): hàng loạt >< minor (adj): thiểu số, ít.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the word(s) OPPOSITE in meaning to the underlined word(s) in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 24: Under the major's able <u>leadership</u>, the soldiers found safety.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ đồng nghĩa. leadership (n): sự lãnh đạo = guidance (n): sự dẫn dắt.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the word(s) CLOSEST in meaning to the underlined word(s) in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 25: Adverts on Facebook seem to be more <u>efficient</u> than billboards or TV ads because of its enormous number of users.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ đồng nghĩa. efficient (adj): hiệu quả = successful (adj): thành công.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the word(s) CLOSEST in meaning to the underlined word(s) in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 26: - Linh: Would you mind moving your suitcase? - Ngoc: _______

options.D: Oh, I am sorry to hear.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Ngôn ngữ giao tiếp. Linh: Bạn có phiền khi di chuyển vali không? - Ngoc: Không, hoàn toàn không.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the most suitable response to complete each of the following exchanges.

questions.passage_text: Urbanisation programmes are being (28) in many parts of the world, especially in densely populated regions with limited land and resources. It is the natural outcome of economic development and (29). It has brought a lot of benefits to our society. (30), it also poses various problems for local authorities and town planners in the process of maintaining sustainable urbanisation, especially in developing countries. When too many people cram into a small area, urban infrastructure can't be effective. There will be a (31) of livable housing, energy and water supply. This will create overcrowded urban districts with no proper facilities. Currently, fast urbanisation is taking place predominantly in developing countries where sustainable urbanisation has little relevance to people's lives. Their houses are just shabby slums with poor sanitation. Their children only manage to get basic education. Hence, the struggle for survival is their first priority rather than anything else. Only when the quality of their existence is improved can they seek (32) other high values in their life.

questions.question: Question 33: According to the text, Marrination, when built, will be a(an) _______ city.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Đọc hiểu. Thông tin: The actual land would be about 300 feet below the sea level. Tạm dịch: Mặt đất thực tế sẽ thấp hơn mực nước biển khoảng 300 feet.
questions.group_instruction: Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the questions.
questions.passage_text: A Japanese construction company plans to create a huge independent city-state, akin to the legendary Atlantis, in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. The city, dubbed "Marinnation", would have about one million inhabitants, two airports, and possibly even a space port. Marinnation, if built, would be a separate country but could serve as a home for international organisations such as the United Nations and the World Bank. Aside from the many political and social problems that would have to be solved, the engineering task envisaged is monumental. The initial stage requires the building of a circular dam eighteen miles in diameter attached to the sea bed in a relatively shallow place in international waters. Then, several hundred powerful pumps, operating for more than a year, would suck out the sea water from within the dam. When empty and dry, the area would have a city constructed on it. The actual land would be about 300 feet below the sea level. According to designers, the hardest task from an engineering point of view would be to ensure that the dam is leak proof and earthquake proof. If all goes well, it is hoped that Marinnation could be ready for habitation at the end of the second decade of the twenty-first century. Whether anyone would want to live in such an isolated and artificial community, however, will remain an open question until that time.

questions.question: Question 38: To attract her teacher's attention, she raised her hand high.

options.A: Because her teacher attracted her, she raised her hand again.
options.B: Though she raised her hand high, she couldn't attract her teacher's attention.
options.C: She raised her hand high so that she could attract the teacher's attention.
options.D: She had such a high raising of hand that she failed to attract her teacher's attention.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Mệnh đề chỉ mục đích. so that: để mà. Cô ấy giơ tay lên cao để có thể thu hút sự chú ý của giáo viên.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 39: The number of young people using social media is increasing.

options.A: There are more people using social media than in the past.
options.B: The number of social media for the youth is increasing.
options.C: More and more social media are for the youth.
options.D: More and more young people are using social media.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: So sánh kép. Cấu trúc so sánh kép với more and more + N: ngày càng nhiều. Ngày càng có nhiều người trẻ tuổi sử dụng phương tiện truyền thông xã hội.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 40: The problem was too serious for her to solve by herself.

options.A: The problem was such serious that she couldn't solve alone.
options.B: So serious was the problem that she couldn't solve it alone.
options.C: It was such a serious problem that she could solve it alone.
options.D: She was so serious she couldn't solve the problem alone.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Mệnh đề chỉ kết quả. Cấu trúc đảo ngữ: So + adj + be + N + that + S + V: ... quá... đến nỗi mà...
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 41: If it hadn't been for the wind, the fire would never have spread so fast.

options.A: Even without the wind, the fire would have spread just as fast.
options.B: It was the wind that caused the fire to spread at such a speed.
options.C: Had there been a wind, the fire would have spread even faster.
options.D: The force of the wind affected the way the fire spread.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Câu điều kiện loại 3 – Câu chẻ. Cấu trúc câu chẻ: It was + danh từ + that + S + V. Chính gió đã khiến ngọn lửa lan rộng với tốc độ như vậy.
questions.group_instruction: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 42: "Don't forget to hand in the report, Peter!" said Kate.

options.A: Kate reminded Peter of handing in the report.
options.B: Kate said that Peter had forgotten to hand in the report.
options.C: Kate forgot to hand in the report to Peter.
options.D: Kate reminded Peter to hand in the report.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Câu gián tiếp. remind sb + to V: nhắc nhở ai làm cái gì. Kate nhắc nhở Peter nộp bản báo cáo.

questions.question: Question 12: <u>Children</u> (A) nowadays seem <u>to be</u> (B) <u>more intelligenter</u> (C) than their parents when they were <u>at</u> (D) the same age.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: So sánh hơn. Công thức so sánh hơn với tính từ dài: S + be + more + long adj + than + S2. Sửa: more intelligenter => more intelligent.

questions.question: Question 13: One of the reasons why families break up is that parents are always <u>critical</u> of each other.

questions.group_instruction: Task 9. Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the correct word or phrase that best fits each of the numbered blanks.
questions.passage_text: Statesmen define a family as "a group of individuals having a common dwelling and related by blood, adoption or marriage, (26) _______ includes common-law relationships." Most people are born into one of these groups and will live their lives as a family in such a group. Although the definition of a family may not change, (27) _______ relationship of people to each other within the family group changes as society changes. More and more wives are taking paying jobs, and, as a result, the roles of husband, wife and children are changing. Today, men expect to work for pay for about 40 years of their lives, and, in today's marriages (28) _______ which both spouses have paying jobs, women can expect to work for about 30 to 35 years of their lives. This means that men must learn to do their share of family tasks such as caring for the children and daily (29) _______ chores. Children, too, especially adolescents, have to (30) _______ with the members of their family in sharing household tasks.

questions.question: Question 31: The pronoun "they" in the second paragraph refers to _______

questions.group_instruction: Task 10. Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the questions.
questions.passage_text: Harvard University, today recognized as part of the top echelon of the world's universities, came from very inauspicious and humble beginning. This oldest of American universities was founded in 1636, just sixteen years after the Pilgrims landed at Plymouth. Included in the puritan emigrants to the Massachusetts colony during this period were more than 100 graduates of England's prestigious Oxford and Cambridge universities, and these universities graduate in the New Word were determined that their sons would have the same educational opportunities that they themselves had had. Because of this support in the colony for an institution of higher learning, the General Court of Massachusetts appropriated 400 pounds for a college in October of 1636 and early the following year decided on a parcel of land for the school; this land was in an area called Newetowne, which was later renamed Cambridge after its English cousin and is the site of the present-day university. When a young minister named John Harvard, who came from the neighboring town of Charlestowne, died from tuberculosis in 1638, he willed half of his estate of 1,700 pounds to the fledgling college. In spite of the fact that only half of the bequest was actually paid, the General Court named the college after the minister in appreciation for what he had done. The amount of the bequest may not have been large, particularly by today's standard, but it was more than the General Court had found it necessary to appropriate in order to open the college. Henry Dunster was appointed the first president of Harvard in 1640, and it should be noted that in addition to serving as president, he was also the entire faculty, with an entering freshmen class of four students. Although the staff did expand somewhat, for the first century of its existence the entire teaching staff consisted of the president and three or four tutors.

questions.question: Question 32: The "pounds" in the second paragraph are probably _______
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Đọc hiểu. Thông tin: '...appropriated 400 pounds for a college...' (chi 400 bảng Anh).

questions.question: Question 33: Which of the following is NOT mentioned about John Harvard?

options.D: How much he bequeathed to Harvard

questions.question:
Question 36: Although he was very tired, he agreed to help me with my homework.
=> Tired _______
questions.correct_answer: as he was, he agreed to help me with my homework
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Mệnh đề nhượng bộ. Cấu trúc: Adj + as/ though + S1 + be, S2 + V2.

questions.question:
Question 37: The man works for my father's company. The man's daughter is fond of dancing. (relative clauses)
=> _______
questions.correct_answer: The man whose daughter is fond of dancing works for my father's company.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Mệnh đề quan hệ. Dùng 'whose' để thay thế cho sở hữu 'The man's'.
questions.group_instruction: Task 11. Rewrite the following sentences so that it means the same as the sentence before it.

questions.question:
Question 38: "I'm sorry, Angela, I'm afraid I've damaged your car," said Martin.
=> Martin apologized _______
questions.correct_answer: to Angela for having damaged her car
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Câu tường thuật. Cấu trúc: S + apologized (+ to O) + for V-ing (xin lỗi ai vì điều gì).
questions.group_instruction: Task 11. Rewrite the following sentences so that it means the same as the sentence before it.

questions.correct_answer: is thought to be the best football player in the 20th century
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Câu bị động đặc biệt. Cấu trúc: S2 + am/is/are + thought + to V.
questions.group_instruction: Task 11. Rewrite the following sentences so that it means the same as the sentence before it.

questions.question: Question 30: According to the reading, an environmental activist is someone who _______

options.A: is a hero, like Paul Watson
options.C: does something to protect the Earth

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Đọc hiểu. Thông tin: Paul Watson is an environmental activist. He is a man who believes that he must do something, not just talk about doing something.
questions.group_instruction: Task 9. Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following sentences below.
questions.passage_text:
ENVIRONMENTAL ACTIVISTS
Paul Watson is an environmental activist. He is a man who believes that he must do something, not just talk about doing something. Paul believes in protecting endangered animals, and he protects them in controversial ways. Some people think that Watson is a hero and admire him very much. Other people think that he is a criminal.
On July 16th, 1979, Paul Watson and his crew were on his ship, which is called the Sea Shepherd. Watson and the people who work on the Sea Shepherd were hunting on the Atlantic Ocean near Portugal. However, they had a strange prey; instead of hunting for animals, their prey was a ship, the Sierra. The Sea Shepherd found the Sierra, ran into it and sank it. As a result, the Sierra never returned to the sea. The Sea Shepherd, on the other hand, returned to its home in Canada. Paul Watson and his workers thought that they had been successful.
The Sierra had been a whaling ship, which had operated illegally. The captain and the crew of the Sierra did not obey any of the international laws that restrict whaling. Instead, they killed as many whales as they could, quickly cut off the meat, and froze it. Later, they sold the whale meat in countries where it is eaten.
Paul Watson tried to persuade the international whaling commission to stop the Sierra. However the commission did very little, and Paul became impatient. He decided to stop the Sierra and other whaling ship in any way that he could. He offered to pay $25,000 to anyone who sank any illegal whaling ship, and he sank the Sierra. He acted because he believes that the whales must be protected. Still, he acted without the approval of the government; therefore, his actions were controversial.
Paul Watson is not the only environmental activist. Other men and women are also fighting to protect the Earth. Like Watson, they do not always have the approval of their governments, and like Watson, they have become impatient. Yet, because of their concern for the environment, they will act to protect it.

questions.question: Question 31: The main idea of paragraph one is that _______

options.A: Paul Watson is a hero to some people
options.B: activists are people who do something
options.C: Paul Watson is a controversial environmental activist
options.D: Paul Watson does not believe in talking

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Đọc hiểu. Đoạn văn 1 giới thiệu Paul Watson là một nhà hoạt động vì môi trường, có nhiều ý kiến trái chiều về những ý tưởng và hoạt động của ông.

ENVIRONMENTAL ACTIVISTS
Paul Watson is an environmental activist. He is a man who believes that he must do something, not just talk about doing something. Paul believes in protecting endangered animals, and he protects them in controversial ways. Some people think that Watson is a hero and admire him very much. Other people think that he is a criminal.
On July 16th, 1979, Paul Watson and his crew were on his ship, which is called the Sea Shepherd. Watson and the people who work on the Sea Shepherd were hunting on the Atlantic Ocean near Portugal. However, they had a strange prey; instead of hunting for animals, their prey was a ship, the Sierra. The Sea Shepherd found the Sierra, ran into it and sank it. As a result, the Sierra never returned to the sea. The Sea Shepherd, on the other hand, returned to its home in Canada. Paul Watson and his workers thought that they had been successful.
The Sierra had been a whaling ship, which had operated illegally. The captain and the crew of the Sierra did not obey any of the international laws that restrict whaling. Instead, they killed as many whales as they could, quickly cut off the meat, and froze it. Later, they sold the whale meat in countries where it is eaten.
Paul Watson tried to persuade the international whaling commission to stop the Sierra. However the commission did very little, and Paul became impatient. He decided to stop the Sierra and other whaling ship in any way that he could. He offered to pay $25,000 to anyone who sank any illegal whaling ship, and he sank the Sierra. He acted because he believes that the whales must be protected. Still, he acted without the approval of the government; therefore, his actions were controversial.
Paul Watson is not the only environmental activist. Other men and women are also fighting to protect the Earth. Like Watson, they do not always have the approval of their governments, and like Watson, they have become impatient. Yet, because of their concern for the environment, they will act to protect it.

questions.passage_text: Nearly 200 of the 1500 native plant species in Hawaii are at risk of going extinct in the near future because they have been (25) _______ to such low numbers. questions.passage_text:
ENVIRONMENTAL ACTIVISTS
Paul Watson is an environmental activist. He is a man who believes that he must do something, not just talk about doing something. Paul believes in protecting endangered animals, and he protects them in controversial ways. Some people think that Watson is a hero and admire him very much. Other people think that he is a criminal.
On July 16th, 1979, Paul Watson and his crew were on his ship, which is called the Sea Shepherd. Watson and the people who work on the Sea Shepherd were hunting on the Atlantic Ocean near Portugal. However, they had a strange prey; instead of hunting for animals, their prey was a ship, the Sierra. The Sea Shepherd found the Sierra, ran into it and sank it. As a result, the Sierra never returned to the sea. The Sea Shepherd, on the other hand, returned to its home in Canada. Paul Watson and his workers thought that they had been successful.
The Sierra had been a whaling ship, which had operated illegally. The captain and the crew of the Sierra did not obey any of the international laws that restrict whaling. Instead, they killed as many whales as they could, quickly cut off the meat, and froze it. Later, they sold the whale meat in countries where it is eaten.
Paul Watson tried to persuade the international whaling commission to stop the Sierra. However the commission did very little, and Paul became impatient. He decided to stop the Sierra and other whaling ship in any way that he could. He offered to pay $25,000 to anyone who sank any illegal whaling ship, and he sank the Sierra. He acted because he believes that the whales must be protected. Still, he acted without the approval of the government; therefore, his actions were controversial.
Paul Watson is not the only environmental activist. Other men and women are also fighting to protect the Earth. Like Watson, they do not always have the approval of their governments, and like Watson, they have become impatient. Yet, because of their concern for the environment, they will act to protect it.

questions.question: Question 37: It is really important to have friends whom you can count on.

options.A: You should have reliable friends whom you can trust.
options.B: Some friends may make your feelings hurt.
options.C: You should not contact with friends who make use of you.
options.D: Do not believe in any friends.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Động từ khuyết thiếu. Thực sự quan trọng khi có những người bạn mà bạn có thể tin cậy = Bạn nên có những người bạn đáng tin cậy mà bạn có thể tin tưởng.

questions.question: Question 38: We planned to walk round the lake, but the heavy rain made this impossible.

options.A: In spite of the heavy rain, we managed to walk half way round the lake as planned.
options.B: We would have walked round the lake even if it had rained heavily.
options.C: The heavy rain nearly prevented us from walking right round the lake.
options.D: If it hadn't rained so heavily, we would have walked round the lake.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Câu điều kiện loại 3. Câu gốc: Chúng tôi dự định đi bộ quanh hồ, nhưng cơn mưa lớn đã khiến điều này trở nên bất khả thi. = D. Nếu trời không mưa quá nhiều, chúng tôi sẽ đi vòng quanh hồ.
questions.group_instruction: Task 10. Mark the letter A, B, C or D on your answer sheet to indicate the sentence that is CLOSEST in meaning to each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 39: I can't stand this weather. It's getting worse and worse.

options.A: I can't stand up in this bad weather.
options.B: The weather is making me worse.
options.C: The weather is not better but I can't stand it.
options.D: I can't bear this bad weather any more.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ vựng. can't stand = can't bear: không thể chịu được. Câu gốc: Tôi không thể chịu được thời tiết này. Nó càng ngày càng xấu đi. = D. Tôi không thể chịu đựng thời tiết xấu như thế này nữa.

questions.question: Question 40: Travellers are advised to take out insurance. Their luggage may go astray.

options.A: Travellers are advised to take out insurance in case their luggage goes astray.
options.B: Travellers had better buy insurance as a precaution against their luggage go astray.
options.C: Travellers should take out insurance if their luggage goes astray.
options.D: Travellers should get insurance, or else their luggage may go astray.

questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Liên từ. Câu gốc: Du khách nên mua bảo hiểm. Hành lý của họ có thể bị thất lạc. = B. Du khách nên mua bảo hiểm để đề phòng hành lý của họ bị thất lạc. (Lưu ý: Đáp án A sai về cấu trúc câu điều kiện hoặc mệnh đề phòng ngừa không bám sát đáp án B theo key giải thích).

questions.question: Question 11: It was suggested that Pedro <u>studies</u> (A) the material <u>more</u> (B) thoroughly before attempting <u>to pass</u> (C) <u>the exam</u> (D).
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Thức giả định. Cấu trúc: S1 + be + suggested (+that) + S2 + (should) Vo. Sửa: studies => study.

questions.question: Question 12: <u>Children</u> (A) nowadays seem <u>to be</u> (B) <u>more intelligenter</u> (C) than their parents when they were <u>at</u> (D) the same age.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: So sánh hơn. Công thức so sánh hơn với tính từ dài: S + be + more + long adj + than + S2. Sửa: more intelligenter => more intelligent.
questions.group_instruction: Task 3. Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the underlined part that needs correction in each of the following questions.

questions.question: Question 13: One of the reasons why families break up is that parents are always <u>critical</u> of each other.
questions.explanation: Kiến thức: Từ trái nghĩa. critical (adj): chỉ trích >< supportive (adj): giúp đỡ, cảm thông.

questions.group_instruction: Task 4. Mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the word(s) OPPOSITE in meaning to the underlined word(s) in each of the following questions.

questions.group_instruction: Task 9. Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C, or D to indicate the correct word or phrase that best fits each of the numbered blanks.
questions.passage_text: Statesmen define a family as "a group of individuals having a common dwelling and related by blood, adoption or marriage, (26) _______ includes common-law relationships." Most people are born into one of these groups and will live their lives as a family in such a group. Although the definition of a family may not change, (27) _______ relationship of people to each other within the family group changes as society changes. More and more wives are taking paying jobs, and, as a result, the roles of husband, wife and children are changing. Today, men expect to work for pay for about 40 years of their lives, and, in today's marriages (28) _______ which both spouses have paying jobs, women can expect to work for about 30 to 35 years of their lives. This means that men must learn to do their share of family tasks such as caring for the children and daily (29) _______ chores. Children, too, especially adolescents, have to (30) _______ with the members of their family in sharing household tasks.
